financial_benefits.description: The Philippines offers a relatively low cost of living compared to many Western countries.
Foreign-sourced income is generally not taxed in the Philippines for non-residents, including digital nomads.

lifestyle_benefits.description: Experience a rich cultural tapestry and diverse natural landscapes across the archipelago.
English is widely spoken and used in business and government, easing communication for expatriates.

additional_benefits.description: Enjoy a tropical climate with warm temperatures throughout the year.
Filipinos are known for their hospitality and welcoming attitude toward foreigners.

key_consideration: The Special Resident Retiree's Visa (SRRV) and other long-term visa options are available for retirees and foreign investors, offering residency privileges.
action_comment: Consider the Philippines for its affordable living, diverse culture, and favorable tax policies for digital nomads.
tagline: Experience the warmth of the Philippines.
tax_residency_trigger_details: You are considered a tax resident if you reside in the Philippines for more than 183 days in a calendar year.

visas.key_consideration: Provides retirees with long-term residency in the Philippines with multiple benefits, including tax incentives.

income_requirement.misc_details: Dependent upon age and type of SRRV applied for; other options include investments in government bonds or real estate.

application_fee.details: Application fees vary based on the SRRV category and number of dependents.

visas.renewability_details: SRRV is renewable as long as requirements are maintained.
visas.special_tax_regime_details: SRRV holders enjoy tax exemptions on foreign income remitted to the Philippines.
visas.permanent_residency_details: SRRV can lead to permanent residency status after a specified period and meeting residency requirements.

special_regimes.name: Special Resident Retiree's Visa (SRRV)
special_regimes.benefit: Tax exemptions on foreign income remitted to the Philippines.
eligibility: Retirees aged 35 and above, or as approved by the Philippine Retirement Authority (PRA).
Minimum pension or retirement income per month.

required_documents: Police clearance certificate from home country

visas.key_consideration: Allows foreigners to work on short-term contracts or assignments in the Philippines.

income_requirement.misc_details: Depends on the employment contract or agreement; no specific income threshold for the SWP.

application_fee.details: Application fee for each SWP application.

visas.renewability_details: SWP can be renewed upon expiry based on continued employment or contract.
visas.permanent_residency_details: SWP does not lead to permanent residency.

special_regimes.name: Special Work Permit (SWP)
special_regimes.benefit: Allows foreigners to work on short-term contracts or assignments in the Philippines.
eligibility: Employment contract or agreement with a Philippine-based employer.

required_documents: Alien Employment Permit (AEP) issued by the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE)
